name: openhardware
cooked:
Hi,

I’m running an open hardware community on https://www.openhardware.io.

It allows open hardware designers to share projects, keep them in sync with a github project and sell their projects on ebay or via our manufacturing partners. Any sales generated will render the author a commission.

Just wish I could become a member of the OSHWA initiative. But as this is a community driven project (with very low income) the fee for applying is a bit high.

Anyway, hope you find the new community useful!

How do I add a link in the FAQ-section here?

Open Source Hardware Association – 10 Apr 12

Open-Source Hardware FAQ

What is open source hardware? Our statement of principles puts it like this: “Open source hardware is hardware whose design is made publicly available so that anyone can study, modify, distri…


Would be great if it could be added to the “When and how should I share my design files?” part.
raw: Hi, I'm running an open hardware community on https://www.openhardware.io. It allows open hardware designers to share projects, keep them in sync with a github project and sell their projects on ebay or via our manufacturing partners. Any sales generated will render the author a commission. Just wish I could become a member of the OSHWA initiative. But as this is a community driven project (with very low income) the fee for applying is a bit high. Anyway, hope you find the new community useful! How do I add a link in the FAQ-section here? http://www.oshwa.org/faq/ Would be great if it could be added to the "When and how should I share my design files?" part.
